content.rendered:
Saman Hazany, MD, DABR

Specialty: Radiology and Neuroradiology

Expertise: Traumatic Brain and Spine Injury Imaging, CT, MRI, DTI

Saman Hazany, MD, DABR

Award-winning, Harvard Trained Traumatic Brain and Spine Injury Imaging Expert and Chief of Neuroradiology at the Greater Los Angeles VA Healthcare System. Academic appointments at major academic centers (UCLA and USC) with a focus on Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) in concussion/mild TBI. Board and Certificate of Added Qualification (CAQ) in radiology and neuroradiology.

Extensive experience in the care of patients with traumatic brain and spine injury, stroke, epilepsy, and brain tumors. 18+ years of experience. Extensive teaching and research leadership experience at USC (2012- present) and UCLA (2019 – present).

Former Radiology department Chair and Director of Neuroradiology at Rancho Los Amigos National Rehabilitation Center (2012-2018). CEO and chief neuroradiology expert witness at Neuro Experts, PC (2018-present), contributing to clinical care and medicolegal issues of numerous patients with neurological disorders. Frequent presenter and invited lecturer in neuroradiology and traumatic brain injury.

  • Complimentary Initial Consultation. Call or email us for second opinion if your neuroimaging was not interpreted by a board and CAQ certified neuroradiologist.
  • Comprehensive Neuroradiology Medical - Legal Evaluation — For attorneys

Imaging is an essential component of a comprehensive approach to neurological disease diagnosis, especially in setting of trauma. In many cases, imaging is the sole objective evidence that supports the true diagnosis and extent of disease. Validity of neuro-imaging and its contribution to the outcome of a litigation, depends on type and quality of images and accuracy of interpretation.

  • Call or email us if you believe your client’s imaging was misinterpreted. Misinterpretation of imaging findings can mislead and erroneously change the course of a litigation. For example, common findings of traumatic brain injury (TBI) such as subtle “subarachnoid hemorrhage”, “brain contusion”, and “volume loss and gliosis”, are regularly missed or misinterpreted by non-expert neuroradiologists. Our TBI imaging expert witnesses, with years of experience at level 1 trauma centers, are leaders in TBI education and research. This enables them to thoroughly assess the imaging protocol and issue an accurate and comprehensive report in correlation with the clients’ history and symptoms.
  • Advanced MR imaging sequences such as Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) are used to provide insight on location, extent, and severity of TBI. These sequences are frequently interpreted inaccurately by non-expert radiologists. Clinical and research expertise in DTI imaging allows our TBI imaging expert witnesses’ accurate interpretation of these complicated and advanced imaging modalities.
  • CONTACT US with questions about DTI.
Danny Benmoshe, MD

Specialty: Neurology

Expertise: Traumatic Brain and Spine Injury Clinical Management, EEG, EMG, NCV

Danny Benmoshe, MD

Dr. Danny Benmoshe is a diplomat of the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology who practices in Los Angeles, California. He is the principal investigator for the Brain Science Research Institute.

Dr. Benmoshe specializes in treating all neurological conditions, including cognitive conditions such as mild traumatic brain injuries, Alzheimer’s disease, and other dementias. He also performs diagnostic tests, including EEG, EMG, and NCV. He is affiliated with Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.

He received his medical degree from Albert Einstein College of Medicine of Yeshiva University in 2005 and did his residency and fellowship at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center. He is fluent in Spanish, Farsi, Hebrew, and English. He has received excellent ratings from his patients for his thoroughness, clarity, and ability to answer questions. He is also recognized as a top neurologist in Los Angeles and a leader in specialized neurological care and brain health.

Contact Dr. Danny

dbenmoshe@neuroexpertsgroup.com

Liorah Sabbah, PhD

Specialty: Neuropsychology

Expertise: Neuropsychological Evaluation of Traumatic Brain Injury, Dementia, Functional Neurological Disorders, and Complex Psychiatric Presentations. 

Liorah Sabbah, PhD

Dr. Liorah Sabbah, PhD, is a clinical neuropsychologist who practices in Los Angeles, California. Dr. Sabbah specializes in evaluating adults and older adults with neurological and medical challenges, including dementia, traumatic brain injury, functional neurological disorders, and complex psychiatric presentations.

She also provides psychotherapeutic interventions, helping individuals optimize cognitive performance and maintain quality of life as they age.

She holds an associate director of clinical training position at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center and an affiliation at California Rehabilitation Institute in inpatient rehabilitation. She received her doctorate degree from Suffolk University in 2018. She completed her internship at the Boston VA Healthcare System – Harvard Medical School program and her fellowship at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, followed by advanced fellowship training in TBI.

She is fluent in French and English. Dr. Sabbah’s approach is grounded in empathy and compassion, creating a supportive space for growth, healing, and resilience.

Contact Dr. Liorah

lsabbah@neuroexpertsgroup.com

Daniel Fenton, PhD

Specialty: Neuropsychology

Expertise: Neuropsychological Evaluation of Traumatic Brain Injury, Cognitive Effects of Trauma and Emotional Injury, and Dementia.

Daniel Fenton, PhD

Dr. Daniel Fenton, PhD, is a clinical neuropsychologist based in Los Angeles, California. Dr. Fenton specializes in the assessment and treatment of individuals with brain injury, cognitive effects of trauma and emotional injury, and various forms of dementia.

He earned his doctorate in clinical psychology with a concentration in neuropsychology from the California School of Professional Psychology. He completed his internship in neuropsychology at the Iowa City VA Healthcare System, followed by advanced fellowship training at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center and additional specialized training in brain injury at California Rehabilitation Institute.

In addition to his clinical practice, Dr. Fenton has provided expert consultation in legal and forensic contexts, assisting numerous attorneys and law firms in achieving favorable case outcomes. His approach integrates scientific precision with compassion, helping clients regain clarity, resilience, and cognitive strength.

Contact Dr. Daniel

dfenton@neuroexpertsgroup.com

Nusha Bashardoust, Physician Assistant

Specialty: Neurology, Emergency Medicine, Dermatology

Expertise: Medical-Legal Evaluations (IME, QME, AME)

Nusha Bashardoust, Physician Assistant

Nusha Bashardoust has been a devoted healthcare provider since 2014, bringing extensive experience in both Emergency Medicine and Dermatology, where she assists with medical-legal evaluations. She obtained her Bachelor’s in Health Promotion and Disease Prevention and her Master of Physician Assistant Practice from the USC Keck School of Medicine, building a strong foundation in evidence-based, patient-centered care.

Her interest in neurology began in the emergency department, where she managed acute neurological cases and saw the significant impact neurological disorders have on patients. This passion led her to transition into neurology, where she now focuses on medical review and evaluation.

Alongside her clinical roles, Nusha has collaborated closely with a Dermatology physician on medical-legal assessments, including Independent Medical Examinations (IMEs), Qualified Medical Evaluations (QMEs), and Agreed Medical Evaluations (AMEs). Known for her analytical skills, attention to detail, and compassionate care, she continues to advance neurological assessment and patient care.

Contact Nusha

nbashardoust@neuroexpertsgroup.com

Sandra Bolando, Executive Manager

Specialty: Office Administration

Expertise: Executive Leadership Support

Sandra Bolando, Executive Manager

Sandra Bolando is an experienced executive professional with a strong background in office administration and leadership support. She is dedicated to maintaining efficient operations and providing exceptional organizational assistance to executive teams.

Contact Sandra

sbolando@neuroexpertsgroup.com

About Neuro Experts, PC

Precision in Neuroradiology, Trust in Expert Care

We are a premier firm for neuroradiology services and unbiased medical-legal consulting led by award-winning CEO Dr. Saman Hazany, MD, DABR. We focus on a wide range of medical imaging techniques for neurodegenerative disorders. With unwavering dedication to patient-centered care, our team can provide exceptional clinical insights for clinical trials and medico-legal cases.

Neuroradiology Expertise from the Industry's Best

At Neuro Experts, PC, we take pride in being led by the industry’s best. Dr. Saman Hazany, a Harvard-trained neuroradiologist with over 15 years in the field, is a recognized expert in concussion and Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) imaging. His innovative work in Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) for TBI cases and his dedication to neuroradiology research and education set Neuro Experts, PC, apart as the go-to center for advanced neuroradiology services.

As a professor of radiology at UCLA and associate professor of radiology at USC, Dr. Hazany has led teaching and research efforts at these world-renowned institutions. He has also served as department chair at Rancho Los Amigos and currently leads Neuro Experts, PC, as founder and CEO. A recognized authority, he regularly offers actionable insights into neuroradiology and brain injury details in clinical, educational, research, and legal contexts while leading the team at Neuro Experts, PC.

Our Mission

At Neuro Experts, PC, our mission is to provide expert neuroradiology care that empowers individuals and professionals with precise and accessible imaging services. We strive to deliver quality images through advanced technology and cutting-edge techniques, improving patient outcomes and supporting medical and legal professionals across California.

We are dedicated to serving medical centers, legal professionals, and, most importantly, patients with unmatched quality and impartial results in interpreting neuroimaging, including Computed Tomography (CT) scans and Magnetic resonance Imaging (MRI). Our goal is to bridge the gap between advanced imaging and legal/clinical needs, ensuring that our patients and clients benefit from the evidence-based, high-quality, and unbiased opinions offered by our spine and brain imaging experts.

Vision

We envision ourselves as a leader in the world of medical-legal consulting and neuroradiology, integrating new-age medical imaging techniques with an unscathed industry reputation and years of expertise. Our vision encompasses a future where our technology and knowledge contribute to timely, accurate, and impactful outcomes in both legal and healthcare spheres. Beyond our expertise in different neurological disorders like multiple sclerosis, spine imaging, brain tumors, traumatic brain and spine injury, and epilepsy, we strive to ensure the information needed to implement justice in an accident, worker’s compensation, criminal, and medical malpractice cases are clearly communicated to the jury, judges, attorneys, and clients.

Core Values

Neuro Experts, PC is nothing without its values, and here are the principles and values we put our faith in

  • Precision: Accurate diagnoses should rely on clear, detailed, and expertly interpreted brain images and spine imaging, and we believe in this. This is why every image and report we provide is carefully analyzed to ensure precision.
  • Compassion: Whether we are discussing clinical cases or, medico-legal cases, or research issues related to neuroradiology, our core work is a commitment to patient-centered care and evidence-based practice of medicine.
  • Integrity: Our team of professionals upholds honesty and transparency, especially when serving as expert witnesses in legal cases. We promise our clients unbiased and accurate opinions with utmost impartiality.

Why Choose Neuro Experts, PC?

At Neuro Experts, PC, we understand that high-quality, specialized imaging can significantly influence outcomes in both medical and legal settings. Here’s why clients trust us with their most critical cases and diagnoses:

  • Comprehensive Neuro-Imaging Professional Services

As a trusted spine and brain imaging interpretation center, we are equipped to provide Comprehensive, unbiased, and precise interpretation of a wide range of imaging modalities such as CT, PET, SPECT, MRI, DTI, functional MRI, MR perfusion, and MR spectroscopy, as well as techniques such as volumetric analysis (Neuroquant, Icometrix, etc.). Our board and CAQ-certified California neuroradiologists ensure that neuro-imaging with clinical indications, including brain tumor, spine degenerative change, multiple sclerosis, stroke, traumatic injury, or epilepsy, are interpreted with clarity and diagnostic accuracy.

  • Medical Legal Consulting

Our expertise extends beyond clinical imaging interpretation with specialized medical-legal consulting services. Neuro Experts, PC provides California radiologist and neuroradiologist expert witness support for personal injury, accident cases, workplace injury, and medical malpractice. Whether assessing complex brain or spine imaging post-accident or offering expert testimony, we maintain impartiality and evidence-based practice.

  • Research Consulting

Neuro Experts, PC is dedicated to advancing neuroradiology through research consulting. We work with research facilities and hospitals to bring forth innovations in imaging for conditions like traumatic brain injury, dementia, epilepsy, and neuro-oncology, including brain and spine tumors.

  • Quick Turnaround Time

When you contact us for neuroradiology services, we offer a quick turnaround time, typically less than 24 – 48 hours. We also offer a complimentary initial consultation and an hour-long live (in-person or virtual) lecture on TBI by our expert witness neuroradiologists.

So, if you have any questions or want to schedule a free consultation, call or email us directly!
